author: Special Correspondent
text:
Election authorities on Tuesday convened a meeting with owners of printing press and publishers at the collectorate here on Tuesday and instructed them to strictly follow the model code of conduct.

Collector and District Election Officer K.S.Palanisamy, who chaired the meeting, said that the name and address of the press owner and those of the publisher should be printed on the front side of the poll-related wall posters, advertisements, and pamphlets as per the provisions of the Representation of People Act, 1951. Printers should obtain declarations from the publishers in two forms. The forms should have details of the number of posters or hand bills printed and the exact cost of the printing.

The printed material and the forms should be submitted to the Collector office within three days of printing.

The pamphlets should not be against law or point to any individual person, religion, caste, language, or community. Action as per law would be initiated against press owners if guidelines were violated and the licence of the press would be suspended, he said.
title: Follow code, printing press owners told
